sentences.english: The incoming tides were bathing the coral reef.
In the righteous kingdom of God, life is at full tide.
sentences.chinese: 在神公義的國度裏，生命是處於漲潮的狀態。

sentences.english: Industry insiders predict that China will see a new round of drink mark-ups after the Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 業內人士預計春節後將現各類飲料普漲潮。

sentences.english: If the flow of the beaches is gentle, the water energy is lessened as it washes up along the shore.
sentences.chinese: 如果海灘漲潮和緩，海水沖刷上岸時水能就會減少。

sentences.english: An extra-close new moon accentuates these monthly spring tides all the more.
sentences.chinese: 一個特別接近地球的新月更加促使了每月的漲潮現象。

sentences.english: Of course, it's somewhere where high tide is at 10. 17 tomorrow night.
sentences.chinese: 當然，這個地方明天晚上的漲潮時間是十點十七分。

sentences.english: I heard the first wave of the rising tide.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見漲潮的第一聲海浪。

sentences.english: It was on the ocean - in fact at high tide it was six feet under water.
sentences.chinese: 漲潮的時候這塊地竟然淹在水面下六英尺。

sentences.english: Neap tides are especially weak tides.
The high tide will erase footprints, and the wind will blow away the foam.
sentences.chinese: 漲潮會抹掉我的足跡，海風會吹去這泡沫。

sentences.english: Compiling dictionaries to keep up with the ebb and flow of the English language is a full-time job.
sentences.chinese: 編輯詞典的總在把握着英語語言的“潮漲潮落”。

sentences.english: And we pass both high tides during each twenty-four-hour rotation of the earth on its axis.
sentences.chinese: 地球自轉24小時期間，我們就會經歷兩次的漲潮。

sentences.english: The hightide will erase my footprints, and the wind will blow away thefoam.
sentences.chinese: 漲潮會抹掉我的足跡，海風會吹去這泡沫。

sentences.english: Beneath us the brown Napo River was rising, in all silence;
sentences.chinese: 在我們下方，褐黃色的納波河水正在漲潮。

sentences.english: The flood and ebb tides alternates with each other.
The flood-tide began in the Ganges and a breeze came up from the south.
sentences.chinese: 恆河的水開始漲潮了，一陣微風從南面吹來。

definition: to camp/to pitch camp/stationed/quartered/Taiwan pr. [zha2 ying2]
howling wind and torrential rain (idiom)/(fig.) difficult, dangerous situation
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
water so clear you can see the bottom
